stem: The pediatric clinic nurse is reviewing care plans for four children. Based on the documentation in the Pediatric Support Matrix, match each child's need with the most appropriate interdisciplinary service.

tabs.title: Nurses' Notes
tabs.content:
Patient A: 2y/o male with significant language delay (no words). Born at 28 weeks gestation. 
Patient B: 7y/o female with Type 1 Diabetes. Parents are concerned about the school nurse not being available for lunch-time insulin. 
Patient C: 5y/o male undergoing a painful bone marrow aspiration tomorrow in the hospital. He is very anxious and scared of 'needles'. 
Patient D: 14y/o female with Cystic Fibrosis. She is struggling with her identity and refusing to do her chest physiotherapy.

tabs.title: Available Support Services
tabs.content:
Early Intervention (EI): 0-3 years. 
Section 504 / IEP: School accommodations for chronic illness. 
Child Life Specialist: Hospitalized children; procedural preparation. 
School Counselor / Teen Clinic: Adolescent psychosocial support.

rows.text: Language delay in a 2-year-old requiring home-based early therapy
Designing an insulin administration plan for a 7-year-old at school
Preparing a 5-year-old for surgery using 'medical play' and toys
Support for an adolescent with a chronic illness struggling with identity

rationale.correct: Early Intervention (c1) is for children 0â€“3 with developmental delays (r1). A Section 504 plan (c2) ensures children with chronic illnesses like Diabetes can receive care at school (r2). Child Life Specialists (c3) use medical play to reduce procedural anxiety in hospitalized kids (r3). Adolescent counselors (c4) manage the unique transition of identity in teens with chronic illness (r4).
clinicalPearls: If a child shows a delay before age 3, 'Early Intervention' is the mandatory NCLEX answer.
A 504 plan is for 'accommodations' (like insulin), while an IEP is for 'educational' changes.
Child Life Specialists are the experts in reducing trauma for hospitalized children.

questionTrap.trap: Referring a hospitalized child with procedural fear to a psychiatrist.
questionTrap.howToOvercome: Use the 'Child Life Specialist' first. They are the frontline experts for developmental-appropriate hospital care.

mnemonic.title: EI is Early
mnemonic.expansion: EI (Early Intervention) starts from birth through age 3.
